titlestmt.titleproper: World War I and II patches, undated.
titlestmt.author: Created by William McCarthy in July 2018.

conventiondeclaration.citation: Describing Archives: A Content Standard, Second Edition

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday July 18, 2019 at 16:09

did.unittitle: World War I and II patches, undated.
did.abstract: This collection contains patches worn during World War I and II. While the first written page discusses that the scrapbook was created by members of the "First Church", there is no specific information as to where this first church is located. This collection includes patches from members of the marines, navy, coast guard, army and also civilian corps. Additionally, there is a set of three pins, a german mine ribbon and a campaign ribbons poster.

corpname.part: United States. Department of the Navy

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the World War I and II patches, undated, RG5382. The Congregational Library & Archive, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was found without any information as to where it came from or when it was received. As a result, it was accessioned in 2018; Accession: 2018-25.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was accessioned and processed by William McCarthy in July 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: This collection contains patches worn during World War I and II. While the first written page discusses that the scrapbook was created by members of the "First Church", there is no specific information as to where this first church is located.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes patches from members of the marines, navy, coast guard, army and also civilian corps. Additionally, there is a set of three pins, a german mine ribbon and a campaign ribbons poster.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection maintains the arrangement of the scrapbook by making the five sections into five individual series. Further, the Army forces are split up into three sub-series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains patches related to the Ground, Air and Service Forces.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains patches related to the Army Ground Forces.

scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains patches related to the Army Air Forces.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains patches related to the Army Service Corps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains patches related to the Navy.

Richard P. Melick - Hospital Apprentice Pharmacist's Mate

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains patches from members of the Marines.

did.unittitle: H. Schuyler Royce, Jr. - 1st Marine Division
John H. Bishop - 4th Marine Aircraft Wing
Joseph F. Benson - Fleet Marine Forces Pacific

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains patches and pins related to civilians participating in World War I and II.

did.unittitle: Charles H. Spilman, Jr. - War Correspondent
Harriet F. Dane - China Burma India Red Cross
Elizabeth Plimpton - Women's Emergency Farm Service
Virginia D. Randall - Army Physical Therapy Aide Pin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the Coast Guard Lieutenant's Insignia for Robert T. Muldoon.

did.unittitle: Robert T. Muldoon - Coast Guard Lieutenant's Insignia
